title: Understanding Relational Databases
text: A relational database is a type of database that stores and provides access to data points that are related to one another. It is based on a structure that allows you to identify and access data in relation to another piece of data in the database.

title: Key Features of Relational Databases
text: Relational databases use tables to store data. Each table, also known as a relation, contains rows and columns. The rows represent records, and the columns represent attributes.

hintAnswer: any collection of data that can be accessed or reassembled without having to reorganize the tables
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes a relational database?
choices: any collection of data that can be accessed or reassembled without having to reorganize the tables
a collection of data that is relational to the data visualization
a table that is used to create data visualization after proper formatting
